unit_learning_outcomes.description: Evaluate the impact of trade-related issues with a specific focus on the trade-offs between efficiency and equity.
Apply trade concepts and theories to trade-related issues and evaluate their impact on stakeholders.
Distinguish between major trade theories and policy measures.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are required to use online resources and complete readings for lecture topics. Readings include relevant textbook chapters and academic/news articles.

enrolment_rules.description: ECON632 or ECON6032 or ECON633 or ECON6033 or ECON649 or ECON6049 or ECON991 or ECON8091 or MGNT603 or ACCG6003 or MGNT809 or MGMT8009

assessments.description: Students work in groups to complete this task which has two components, both worth 5%. Individual students from each group present a summary of the group discussion to the whole class, and post a 500 word discussion summary on iLearn.
Five online discussions will be held throughout the session, where students are expected to post a 500 word discussion summary on iLearn.
The assignment will include application/discussion questions regarding a specific trade issue related to the trade-off between efficiency and equity.
The assignment will include application/discussion questions regarding a specific trade issue related to the trade-off between efficiency and equity.
The Online Test 1 will take place in week 7 and will include short-answer and long-answer questions based on lecture topics covered in weeks 1-6.
The assignment will include application/discussion questions regarding a specific trade issue related to the trade-off between efficiency and equity.
Students are permitted to bring one double-sided A4 sheet of handwritten or printed notes to the 80 minute mid-session test.
The Online Test 1 will take place in week 7 and will include short-answer and long-answer questions based on lecture topics covered in weeks 1-6.
The Online Test 2 will take place in week 13 and will include short-answer and long-answer questions based on all topics covered throughout the session.
The Online Test 2 will take place in week 13 and will include short-answer and long-answer questions based on all topics covered throughout the session.
A two-hour final exam will take place during the University Examination Period. Students are permitted to bring in one double-sided A4 sheet of handwritten or printed notes.
Every week, students are required to post their response to one of the discussion questions into ilearn.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit examines international trade both in theory and practice. It aims to provide students with an understanding of major trade issues around the world and the effects of globalisation on international trade in general. The unit is taught in two parts. Firstly, it reviews theories related to inter- and intra-industry trade and the relevant empirical evidence. Secondly, the unit discusses trade policies, covering a wide range of topics, illustrated by theories as well as historical and contemporary data and cases.
data.title: International Trade

title: International Trade
